project_shelf_optimization.name: Eye Level Economics
project_shelf_optimization.notes: Tracks the progress of model development through various stages (e.g. naming, question_definition, data_collection/sourcing, exploration, etc.)

steps.name: How does shelf placementâ€”eye-level, mid, or lowerâ€”affect product sales across retail categories?
steps.notes: The goal is to quantify the sales lift from premium placement and identify which categories yield the highest return per unit of shelf space.

steps.name: Data Collection
steps.notes: The goal is to gather data on product placement and sales across different retail categories.

steps.name: Data Cleaning
steps.notes: The goal is to clean and preprocess the data for analysis.

steps.name: Data Normalization
steps.notes: The goal is to normalize the data to ensure consistency and comparability.

steps.name: Data Exploration
steps.notes: The goal is to explore the data to identify patterns and insights.

steps.name: Data Enhancement
steps.notes: Enhance the data by adding new features or improving existing ones.

steps.name: Data Visualization
steps.notes: Create visualizations to better understand the relationships in the data.

steps.name: Model Building
steps.notes: Build predictive models to analyze the impact of shelf placement on sales.

steps.name: Model Evaluation
steps.notes: Evaluate the models using appropriate metrics to ensure accuracy and reliability.

steps.name: Storytelling
steps.notes: Develop a compelling narrative around the findings to communicate insights effectively.
